com.nerjal.json.parser

Class StringParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nerjal.json.parser.StringParser
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FileParser

    public class StringParser
extends Object

    A parser to get a JSON5 structure from a string

    Once initiated, use parse() to parse the string and get the corresponding JsonElement.
    Alternatively, use the static method parse(String) to directly parse a string to the corresponding element.

    Since:
    JDK 16
    Author:
    nerjal
    See Also:
    JsonParser

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StringParser()
      Empty StringParser.
      Use setParseString(String) to set the string to be parsed.
      StringParser(String s)
      Instantiates a parser with the specified string as the string to parse, thus ready to run.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Builds and returns a new JsonError.JsonParseException for the running methods.

      Increments indexes.
      Used for superclasses, while keeping index and lineIndex private.

      Parses the instance's string to the corresponding JsonElement, and returns it.
      All parsing exceptions are passed to the caller.

      Static methods that instantiate a new parser with the specified string and runs it directly, only returning the parsing output.
      All parsing exceptions are passed to the caller.

      Parses the instance's string to the corresponding JsonElement.
      All parsing exceptions are passed to the caller.
      void setParseString(String s)
      Sets or changes the string to be parsed for the specified one.
      Also resets all parsing attributes, allowing to use the same parser to parse multiple strings.
      void switchState(ParserState parserState)
      Changes the parser's state with the specified one if the parser is running.

    • Method Detail

      • incrementIndexes

        protected final void incrementIndexes()
        Increments indexes.
        Used for superclasses, while keeping index and lineIndex private.

      • setParseString

        public void setParseString(String s)
        Sets or changes the string to be parsed for the specified one.
        Also resets all parsing attributes, allowing to use the same parser to parse multiple strings.
        Parameters:
        s - the string to be parsed

      • parse

        public static JsonElement parse(String s)
                         throws JsonError.JsonParseException
        Static methods that instantiate a new parser with the specified string and runs it directly, only returning the parsing output.
        All parsing exceptions are passed to the caller.
        Parameters:
        s - the string to be parsed
        Returns:
        the JsonElement corresponding to the specified string
        Throws:
        JsonError.JsonParseException - if any exception is raised while trying to parse the specified string

      • parse

        public JsonElement parse()
                  throws JsonError.JsonParseException
        Parses the instance's string to the corresponding JsonElement, and returns it.
        All parsing exceptions are passed to the caller.
        Returns:
        the instance's string' corresponding JsonElement
        Throws:
        JsonError.JsonParseException - if any exception is raised while trying to parse the specified string

      • read

        public void read()
          throws JsonError.JsonParseException,
                 NullPointerException
        Parses the instance's string to the corresponding JsonElement.
        All parsing exceptions are passed to the caller.
        Throws:
        JsonError.JsonParseException - if any exception is raised while trying to parse the specified string
        NullPointerException - if the instance's string is null

      • getElem

        public final JsonElement getElem()
                          throws JsonError.JsonParseException
        Returns the parser's parsing result
        Returns:
        the parser's parsing result
        Throws:
        JsonError.JsonParseException - if the parser hasn't run or has since been reset

      • switchState

        public void switchState(ParserState parserState)
        Changes the parser's state with the specified one if the parser is running.
        Parameters:
        parserState - the parser's new state
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - is the parser is not running when trying to apply the changes.

      • forward

        public void forward()
        Moves forward the parser's cursor if it is already running.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the parser is not running when trying to apply the changes.

      • forward

        public void forward(int i)
        Moves the parser's cursor of the specified index change if it is already running.
        Eg. #formard(-4) -> cursor -= 4
        Parameters:
        i - the cursor position move factor (positive being forward)
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the parser is not running when trying to apply the changes.

      • increaseLine

        public final void increaseLine()
        Increases the parser's line index if it is already running.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the parser is not running when trying to apply the changes.

        Returns the parser's current cursor position

        the parser's current cursor position
